comments.body:
Q: We cannot accept this query? It seems pogresql can though;
```
postgres=# SELECT * FROM t1, LATERAL (SELECT t1.*, t2.* FROM t2, LATERAL (SELECT t1.*, t2.*, t3.* FROM t2 AS t3) t) t;
 c1 | c2 | c1 | c2 | c1 | c2 
----+----+----+----+----+----
  0 |  1 |  0 |  1 |  0 |  2
  0 |  1 |  0 |  1 |  0 |  2
  0 |  1 |  0 |  1 |  0 |  3
  0 |  1 |  0 |  1 |  0 |  3
  1 |  2 |  1 |  2 |  0 |  2
  1 |  2 |  1 |  2 |  0 |  2
  1 |  2 |  1 |  2 |  0 |  3
  1 |  2 |  1 |  2 |  0 |  3
```

Good question. Current Spark can only resolve the subquery using the immediate outer query. In this case t1.* can only be resolved using output from t2, which is c1, c2. There are many other places need to be updated to support nested subqueries with deep correlations.
https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/9c157a490bb59e02dcf44b14b411ea5beb68c238/sql/catalyst/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/catalyst/expressions/subquery.scala#L164-L173
Ah, ok. Thank you for the explanation. If there is a possibility to support it in future work, could you leave some comments there?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +113,117 @@
-- !query
SELECT * FROM t1, LATERAL (SELECT t1.*, t2.* FROM t2, LATERAL (SELECT t1.*, t2.*, t3.* FROM t2 AS t3))
-- !query schema
struct<>
